page.title: 01Didley
page.content: Didley is a small scattered hamlet situated along the A465 trunk road just west of centre in the block. To the north west are wooded slopes and the remainder of the area is mostly a flattish valley of good, deep agricultural land supporting about a dozen farmsteads a wide variety of livestock and crops. In addition to the A465 the area is travessed by a number of lesser roads, a main line railway and a brook (worm Brook) with a number of tributarys. The whole is an area of much natural beauty with hedgrows, trees streams and pleasant views. although the area is predominantly agricultural more then half the inhabitants are engaged in other employments, many in nearby Hereford.
